title: I'm A Celeb hosts Ant and Dec cuddle namesake puppies as they back Guide Dogs appeal
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

They’ll soon be surrounded by creepy crawlies and snakes in the I’m A Celebrity jungle, but Ant and Dec have cuddled up with some nicer animals for a good cause.

To mark this year’s Guide Dogs Appeal, Pups to Partnerships, the Geordie duo have had two guide dog pups named after them.

An adorable yellow Labrador puppy has been named after Ant while the playful Golden Retriever has been named after Dec.

Ant and Dec are supporting this year’s Guide Dogs Appeal which follows the progress of a group of seven puppies.

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

Throughout October, the charity is sharing the journey of the puppies as they progress to become life-changing guide dogs.

Speaking of the partnership, Ant said: “We’re so proud to be part of the Pups to Partnerships campaign; not only do we get to meet these adorable puppies but we also get to hear about the great work that Guide Dogs does.”

Dec added: “These puppies will go on to change lives and give two people living with sight loss the independence and freedom we take for granted; we can’t wait to see how these puppies progress.”

(Image: PA)

(Image: PA)

Ant and Dec will be jetting Down Under in the coming weeks to start work on the next series of I'm A Celebrity.

The new series of the show starts next month and will mark Ant's big return after taking last year off.

He stepped away from showbiz in the aftermath of his drink-driving conviction, and fellow ITV star Holly Willoughy took his place.
description: Telly duo Ant McPartlin and Declan Donnelly have had two pooches named after them
